Pre-Game Insights: Turkey will start as the slight favourites but the Welsh threat cannot be overlooked.
Wales has managed a solitary victory along with four draws and a defeat in their last six matches.
Turkey was the surprise of the summer, going all the way to the quarter-finals of the European Championship.
Turkey has witnessed the rise of numerous talents over the summer who will now have another chance to settle in better at the international level.
Vincenzo Montella is expected to continue with his hybrid 5-4-1 system which can modify to a three-at-the-back in possession.
Aaron Ramsey will be included in Wales' squad and will also serve as the captain.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The last outing between the two sides occurred in late 2023 at the Euro Qualifiers, ending in a 1-1 draw.
Arda Guler was sensational at the European Championship, scoring a goal and providing two assists.
Mert GÃ¼nok delivered a quite outstanding shot-stopping display and his incredible last-minute save against Austria in the round of 16 was voted as the moment of the tournament.
Others: The match will be held at the Cardiff City Stadium on 6th September at 6:45 PM GMT.
Wales will commence a new era in its football journey with the appointment of Craig Bellamy as the head coach.
Turkey is expected to dominate the game against Wales but can also expect quality chances at its goal from the Welsh.
